commit.message: Turns out cursor pos resp does get interrupted

README bugfix: example script

* The example script did not work in Python 3.x due to the string
  literal being loaded through repr().  The code was clearly written
  for Py 2.x and not tested against 3.x (probably a while ago).
* Adding a simple check for the major release version in order to try
  to decode() the string (Py2) or not (Py3) should address this.
* Note that Py2 output is as unicode strings and thus will display as
  "u'x'" while Py3 will only display "'x'" (assuming "x" was pressed).
* Tested on CPython 2.7 and 3.7.

Tested-by: Ben McGinnes <ben@adversary.org>
Signed-off-by: Ben McGinnes <ben@adversary.org>
still use io.open(encoding=) for py2 compat

Version bump to 0.3.4

I missed committing the last version to the repo (!) so this includes
CHANGELOG edits for both.

Pypi format fix (#148)

* fix PyPi formatting

commit.message:
Re-add escape backslash to fix bpython error
Undoes commit fa66e which removed this backslash
Update changelog for new release
Added docstrings; changed speed of snake to make game more playable; prompts user to press enter before starting game
Added docstrings
Version bump
Add comment, re-word demo print message
Remove unused imports

Added git blame ignore file

- Initilized the file with the first commit where we Black format
Black-formatted code

Added black configuration and marked ignore spots

- Created pyproject.toml which configures black and tells it files and
folders to ignore
- Wrote '# fmt: off' and '# fmt: on' in some files to ignore lines
that black formatting would otherwise ruin

Updated setup.md with auto formatting details

Also reformatted and enhanced some existing info in the file
Added a docstring to Nonblocking context manager
Changed Alt to Meta and removed some comments.
Added keys see issue 119

Fixed escape sequence issue

Removed the backslash before the open square
bracket to fix issue with invalid escape sequence.
Fixes #128
Worked on the tests
removed python2 help
move doc generation to Python3
Update docs build
Fix outdated screenshot in ReadMe
Made minor copyediting edits to the docs and docstrings; primarily spelling and punctuation mistakes.
Changed level of logging messages from warning to debug
